claim_target: Dappankuthu is a popular folk dance in Tamil Nadu, performed by groups of dancers in two rows facing each other. The dance is usually accompanied by energetic percussion music and rhythmic clapping. It is also common to tie a handkerchief or bandana around one's forehead and/or wrist. Loud clapping and whistling by spectators often accompany the dappankuthu dance. Spectators are also known to set off firecrackers called locally as "Pattaasu" on the ground during the performance. Facial expressions are employed for effect by the dancers. A mix of beat patterns layered and flowing into one another may be employed in Dappankuthu. Other percussion instruments may also be used.

Loud clapping and whistling by spectators often accompany the dappankuthu dance. Spectators are also known to set off firecrackers called locally as "Pattaasu" on the ground during the performance. Facial expressions are employed for effect by the dancers. A mix of beat patterns layered and flowing into one another may be employed in Dappankuthu. Other percussion instruments may also be used.
